bug.short_desc: ECMALint: warn if reference types like maps or arrays are used in the members section

long_desc.thetext: If reference types like maps or arrays are used in the members section of a qooxdoo class the contents of those values are shared among all instances. This is usually not desired and can lead to errors, which are hard to find. The ecmalint tool should be enhanced to warn in such situations.
It would be great if this feature can also be added to the 0.7.x codebase.
The above comment #2 seems to belong to bug #1824 and has been copied over.

Would certainly be nice also for 0.8.3 (see bug #1824), but it seems be less critical for the framework code base itself, rather interesting for app development. Before there is additional tool support available this potential issue should be communicated among developers as in http://qooxdoo.org/documentation/0.8/antipatterns#reference_types_in_member_section .
@Fabian, if this one is to intricate for 0.8.3, I'd suggest targeting other ecmalint improvements first.
